name: prosaically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that lacks interest, imagination, or excitement: more prosaically The palace has become home to various museums and, more prosaically, a conference centre. The writers' first meeting was, prosaically, at breakfast-time.
More examplesFewer examplesThe modern dinosaurs that are alive today are known more prosaically as birds. This story of an obsession that destroyed so many lives began prosaically enough with the actions of a weak and selfish man.His autobiography, published in 2003, was prosaically entitled "The Scientist".
